title: How to Make Lord Jashin's Symbol out of Paper

steps.headline: First, fold an 8x11 piece of paper in half lengthwise.
Next, cut the paper along the fold.
Fold each piece of paper in half lengthwise again, then cut.
steps.description: Continue in this manner until each piece of paper measures 1" x 11".

steps.headline: Fold each 1" x 11" piece of paper again so it becomes 0.5" x 11".
Take one of the 0.5" x 11" pieces of paper and make small folds until the paper forms a "C" shape.
steps.description: Repeat this step with another piece of paper. You should have two "C" shaped pieces of paper.

steps.headline: Place the edges of each "C" inside of the other.
steps.description: The top "point" of the "C" would rest in the other top "point" of the "C" so it looks like a circle. Then tape them together.

steps.headline: Take another of the 0.5" x 11" pieces of paper and place it near the top of the symbol, where the top of the upside down equilateral triangle would be.
Cut the strip flush with the edges of the circle and tape it.
Turn the circle one turn clockwise.
Repeat steps 8 through 10 for each side of the equilateral triangle.
steps.description: Now you have your finished symbol.

text: First, fold an 8x11 piece of paper in half lengthwise. Folded paper should measure 4" x 11". Next, cut the paper along the fold.  Fold each piece of paper in half lengthwise again, then cut. Continue in this manner until each piece of paper measures 1" x 11". Fold each 1" x 11" piece of paper again so it becomes 0.5" x 11". DO NOT CUT. Take one of the 0.5" x 11" pieces of paper and make small folds until the paper forms a "C" shape. Repeat this step with another piece of paper. You should have two "C" shaped pieces of paper. Place the edges of each "C" inside of the other. The top "point" of the "C" would rest in the other top "point" of the "C" so it looks like a circle. Then tape them together. Take another of the 0.5" x 11" pieces of paper and place it near the top of the symbol, where the top of the upside down equilateral triangle would be.  Cut the strip flush with the edges of the circle and tape it.  Turn the circle one turn clockwise.  Repeat steps 8 through 10 for each side of the equilateral triangle. Now you have your finished symbol.
